#IMPORTING NECESSARY PACKAGES.
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot  as plt
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
%matplotlib inline
source.311b0328:
fig_map = go.Figure(data=[
    go.Scattergeo(lat=df['lat'],
             lon=df['lon'],
             mode='markers',
             hoverinfo='text',
             marker=dict(color="darkred", size=5, opacity=0.9))
])
fig_map.update_geos(
    landcolor='white',
    showocean=True,
    oceancolor='white',
    lakecolor='blue',
)
fig_map.update_layout(
    width=800,
    height=400,
    template="plotly_white",
    margin=dict(r=0, t=0, b=0, l=0),
    annotations=[
        dict(
            text="",
            showarrow=False,
            xref="paper",
            yref="paper",
            x=0,
            y=0)
    ])

fig_map.show()
source.9ba63d0b:
ABOVE PLOTS SHOWS THAT
* THERES NO HUGE DIFFERENCE IN TRAFFIC DURING DAYS OF THE WEEK.
* THERE IS LESS TRAFFIC IN THE MONTH OF MARCH WHICH IS DUE TO RESISTRICTIONS DUE TO COVID.
